BasicShapes

Class Field

  • java.lang.Object
    • BasicShapes.Field

extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Detail

      • garbage

        public int garbage

    • Constructor Detail

      • Field

        public Field(int id)
        Basic constructor. Each field should have id that is unique to it. Please do not create fields with duplicate ids.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique id of this field.

    • Method Detail

      • setType

        public void setType(int type)
        Sets the type of the field to what you want.
        Parameters:
        type - What type of field it is.

      • getType

        public int getType()
        Returns what type of field this is. Value for the types of field are stored in QConstants.
        Returns:
        The type of field this is.

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Returns id of this field. It will almost always be unique, unless design is somewhat stupid.
        Returns:
        Id that represents this field.

      • addField

        public boolean addField(Field field)
        Creates connection between supplied field and this field. Will not work if you try to add field that is already connected to it. Also will not work if you try to add this field to itself.
        Parameters:
        field - field object to which to connect this object.
        Returns:
        true if the fields connected, false otherwise.

      • getNumOfNeighbors

        public int getNumOfNeighbors()
        Tell you how many neighbors this field has.
        Returns:
        how many fields are attached to this one.

      • getFieldByIndex

        public Field getFieldByIndex(int index)
        Returns the field at a given index. If index is less than 0 or bigger than the given size you get null. So don't be stupid!
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the neighbor you want to get.
        Returns:
        null if you are stupid, the field otherwise.

      • getFieldById

        public Field getFieldById(int id)
        Returns the field by a given id. If there is no field attached by the given id, then null is returned.
        Parameters:
        id - the neighbor's id of the field you want.
        Returns:
        null if no neighbor with given id is found. Field with id otherwise.

      • removeFieldByIndex

        public boolean removeFieldByIndex(int index)
        Removes field by the given index. If index is invalid then nothing will happen.
        Parameters:
        index - true if the field was removed, false otherwise.

      • removeFieldById

        public boolean removeFieldById(int id)
        Removes field by the given id. If index is invalid then nothing will happen. Yes this method is costly, live with it. Why the heck would you even go about removing fields anyway?
        Parameters:
        id - true if the field was removed, false otherwise.

      • getNeighbors

        public java.util.List<Field> getNeighbors()
        Returns all the neighbors attached to this field.
        Returns:
        List which contains all the neighbors of this field.
